content.question: A rigid, thermally-conductive container is filled with two moles of a monatomic ideal gas and sealed. The gas initially has temperature <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> and pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>. The container is placed in a warm water bath until the temperature of the gas has increased to <math alttext="three halves T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>T</mi></math>. Which of the following is equal to the change in internal energy of the gas?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
